A controller account should not be set t: A controller account should not be set to manage multiple stashes. The selected controller is already controlling {{stashId}}
A controller account should not map to a: A controller account should not map to another stash. This selected controller is a stash, controlled by {{bondedId}}
All rewards will go towards the selected: All rewards will go towards the selected output destination when a payout is made.
All the listed validators and all their: All the listed validators and all their nominators will receive their rewards.
Any account can request payout for stake: Any account can request payout for stakers, this is not limited to accounts that will be rewarded.
As such it is recommended that you setup: As such it is recommended that you setup a proxy to control operations via the stash.
Distinct stash and controller accounts a: Distinct stash and controller accounts are recommended to ensure fund security. You will be allowed to make the transaction, but take care to not tie up all funds, only use a portion of the available funds during this period.
For fund security, your session key shou: For fund security, your session key should not match your stash key.
If you have not claimed rewards straight: If you have not claimed rewards straight after the end of the era, the validator is in the active set and you are seeing no rewards, this would mean that the reward payout transaction was made by another account on your behalf. Always check your favorite explorer to see any historic payouts made to your accounts.
No funds staked yet. Bond funds to valid: No funds staked yet. Bond funds to validate or nominate a validator
No pending payouts for your stashes: No pending payouts for your stashes
No pending payouts for your validators: No pending payouts for your validators
Nominators can be selected manually from: Nominators can be selected manually from the list of all currently available validators.
Not participating in any pools. Join a p: Not participating in any pools. Join a pool first.
Once bonded, it will need to be unlocked: Once bonded, it will need to be unlocked/withdrawn and will be locked for at least the bonding duration.
Once transmitted the new selection will: Once transmitted the new selection will only take effect in 2 eras since the selection criteria for the next era was done at the end of the previous era. Until then, the nominations will show as inactive.
Once transmitted the new selection will only take effect in 2 eras taking the new validator election cycle into account. Until then, the nominations will show as inactive.
One of your available nomination account: One of your available nomination accounts, keyed by the stash. The transaction will be sent from the controller.
Payouts of rewards for a validator can b: Payouts of rewards for a validator can be initiated by any account. This means that as soon as a validator or nominator requests a payout for an era, all the nominators for that validator will be rewarded. Each user does not need to claim individually and the suggestion is that validators should claim rewards for everybody as soon as an era ends.
Retrieving all available bags, this will: Retrieving all available bags, this will take some time
Retrieving info for the selected eras, t: Retrieving info for the selected eras, this will take some time
Rewards (once paid) can be deposited to: Rewards (once paid) can be deposited to either the stash or controller, with different effects.
Since this transaction deals with fundin: Since this transaction deals with funding, the stash account will be used.
Stash account (do not increase the amoun: Stash account (do not increase the amount at stake)
Stash account (increase the amount at st: Stash account (increase the amount at stake)
The All bags list is composed of bags th: The All bags list is composed of bags that each describe a range of active bonded funds of the nominators. In each bag is a list of nodes that correspond to a nominator and their staked funds.
The Threshold must be a positive number: The Threshold must be a positive number
The UI puts a limit of 40 payouts at a t: The UI puts a limit of 40 payouts at a time, where each payout is a single validator for a single era.
The account that will submit the rebag t: The account that will submit the rebag transaction.
The accounts that will be rebagged as a: The accounts that will be rebagged as a result of this operation.
The amount placed at-stake should allow: The amount placed at-stake should allow some free funds for future transactions.
The amount placed at-stake should not be: The amount placed at-stake should not be your full available amount to allow for transaction fees.
The amount the is to be rebonded from th: The amount the is to be rebonded from the value currently unlocking, i.e. previously unbonded
The amount to unbond. It should be less: The amount to unbond. It should be less or equal to the full bonded amount.
The bonded amount is less than the curre: The bonded amount is less than the current active minimum nominated amount of {{minNomination}} and depending on the network state, may not be selected to participate
The bonded amount is less than the minim: The bonded amount is less than the minimum bond amount of {{existentialDeposit}}
The bonded amount is less than the minimum threshold of {{minBond}} for nominators
The bonded amount is less than the minimum threshold of {{minBond}} for validators
The commission is below the on-chain min: The commission is below the on-chain minimum of {{p}}%
The commission is deducted from all rewa: The commission is deducted from all rewards before the remainder is split with nominators.
The controller does not have sufficient: The controller does not have sufficient funds available to cover transaction fees. Ensure that a funded controller is used.
The funds will only be available for wit: The funds will only be available for withdrawal after the unbonding period, however will not be part of the staked amount after the next validator election. You can follow the unlock countdown in the UI.
The hex output from author_rotateKeys, a: The hex output from author_rotateKeys, as executed on the validator node. The keys will show as pending until applied at the start of a new session.
The key type and crypto type to use for: The key type and crypto type to use for this key. Be aware that different keys have different crypto requirements. You should be familiar with the type requirements for the different keys.
The pool and pool member that is to be a: The pool and pool member that is to be affected. The transaction will be sent from the associated pool member account.
The seed and derivation path will be sub: The seed and derivation path will be submitted to the validator node. this is an advanced operation, only to be performed when you are sure of the security and connection risks.
The selected controller tied to this sta: The selected controller tied to this stash. Once set, this account will be able to control the actions performed by the stash account.
The selected destination account does no: The selected destination account does not exist and cannot be used to receive rewards
The selected validators to nominate, eit: The selected validators to nominate, either via the "currently best algorithm" or via a manual selection.
The specified value is large and may not: The specified value is large and may not allow enough funds to pay future transaction fees.
The stash account that is used. This wil: The stash account that is used. This will allow the controller to perform all non-funds related operations on behalf of the account.
The stash should be treated as a cold wa: The stash should be treated as a cold wallet.
The stash that is to be affected.
The stash that is to be affected. The tr: The stash that is to be affected. The transaction will be sent from the associated controller account.
The validator can block any new nominati: The validator can block any new nominations. By default it is set to allow all nominations.
There is currently an ongoing election f: There is currently an ongoing election for new validator candidates. As such staking operations are not permitted.
Think of the stash as your cold wallet a: Think of the stash as your cold wallet and the controller as your hot wallet. Funding operations are controlled by the stash, any other non-funding actions by the controller itself.
This could mean your nomination has not: This could mean your nomination has not been applied to any validator in the active set by the election algorithm or it has been applied against a validator who is either oversubscribed or chilled.
This operation will submit the seed via: This operation will submit the seed via an RPC call. Do not perform this operation on a public RPC node, but ensure that the node is local, connected to your validator and secure.
This pubic key is what will be visible i: This pubic key is what will be visible in your queued keys list. It is generated based on the seed and the crypto used.
To ensure optimal fund security using th: To ensure optimal fund security using the same stash/controller is strongly discouraged, but not forbidden.
Use the account actions to create a new: Use the account actions to create a new validator/nominator stash and bond it to participate in staking. Do not send funds directly via a transfer to a validator.
Within the context of a single bag, node: Within the context of a single bag, nodes are not sorted by their stake, but instead placed in insertion order. In other words, the most recently inserted node will be the last node in the bag, regardless of stake. Events like staking rewards or slashes do not automatically put you in a different bag. The bags-list pallet comes with an important permissionless extrinsic: rebag. This allows anyone to specify another account that is in the wrong bag, and place it in the correct one.
You can either bond a specific amount fr: You can either bond a specific amount from your free balance, or all of the accumulated rewards.
You should trust your nominations to act: You should trust your nominations to act competently and honest; basing your decision purely on their current profitability could lead to reduced profits or even loss of funds.
Your bonded amount is below the on-chain: Your bonded amount is below the on-chain minimum threshold of {{minBond}} and may be chilled. Bond extra funds to increase the bonded amount.
filter by name, address or index: filter by name, address or index
the stash account to nominate with: the stash account to nominate with
